intro: Ruehssia gymnemoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ruehssia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
